text.content:
Environmental Effects & Hazards

Natural and supernatural dangers in the world

Temperature Extremes

Extreme Cold

When temperature drops below 0° Fahrenheit:

  • Every hour: DC 10 Constitution save
  • Failure: Gain 1 Exhaustion level
  • Cold resistance or protective gear grants Advantage

Extreme Heat

When temperature exceeds 100° Fahrenheit:

  • Every hour without water: DC 5 Constitution save (DC increases by 1 each hour)
  • Failure: Gain 1 Exhaustion level
  • Protective clothing or heat resistance grants Advantage

Wilderness Hazards

Falling

  • Take 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 10 feet fallen
  • Maximum 20d6 damage (200 feet)
  • Land Prone unless you avoid damage
  • Falling onto a creature: Both make DC 15 Dexterity save

Suffocation

  • Can hold breath for 1 + Constitution modifier minutes (minimum 30 seconds)
  • When out of breath: Survive number of rounds equal to Constitution modifier (minimum 1)
  • After that: Drop to 0 HP and dying

Drowning

  • Same rules as suffocation
  • Swimming in rough water may require Athletics checks
  • Exhaustion makes swimming difficult

Starvation & Dehydration

Food:

  • Need 1 pound of food per day
  • Can go without food for 3 + Constitution modifier days (minimum 1)
  • After that: Gain 1 Exhaustion per day

Water:

  • Need 1 gallon of water per day (2 gallons in hot weather)
  • Half ration counts as half a day without water
  • After 1 day without water: Gain 1 Exhaustion
  • Exhaustion from dehydration can't be removed until you drink sufficient water

Weather Effects

Heavy Precipitation

Rain or snow:

  • Lightly obscures area (Disadvantage on Perception)
  • Disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing
  • Extinguishes open flames

Strong Wind

  • Disadvantage on ranged weapon attacks
  • Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing
  • Extinguishes open flames
  • Flying creatures must land or fall
  • Disperses fog and mist

Fog

  • Heavily obscures area
  • Creatures are effectively Blinded
  • Disadvantage on Perception checks

Dangerous Terrain

Difficult Terrain

Costs 2 feet of movement per 1 foot traveled:

  • Rubble and undergrowth
  • Steep stairs
  • Snow and ice
  • Shallow bogs

Slippery Ice

  • Difficult terrain
  • Dexterity (Acrobatics) DC 10 check to avoid falling Prone
  • When running or charging: DC 10 Dexterity save or fall Prone

Thin Ice

  • Weight of 300+ pounds breaks the ice
  • Creature falls through and is submerged
  • Must escape using Athletics (Swimming) or break through from below

Quicksand

  • Deep quicksand: 1d6 × 5 feet deep
  • Creature that enters sinks 1d4 + 1 feet
  • Athletics or Acrobatics check to escape (DC 10 + feet sunk)
  • Sinking continues each round without successful check

Fire

  • Catching fire: Take 1d10 fire damage
  • Each round: DC 10 Dexterity save or take 1d10 fire damage
  • Can use action to put out fire on self or adjacent creature

Poison and Disease

  • Constitution saving throw to resist
  • Effects vary by poison/disease type
  • Some require multiple saves over time
  • Lesser Restoration can cure some diseases
